resources:
About About LANShield Agree All Allow Allowed Alter blocking policy on a per app basis Anonymous sharing Any detected LAN traffic 
will be shown here LANShield Automatically start on boot Back Block Block or allow LAN traffic by default Blocked Cancel Cancel search Change LAN access policy Are you sure you want to remove all monitored LAN traffic of %1$s? This can not be undone. Choose whether LAN traffic should be allowed or blocked by default Clear all Clear LAN traffic "Configure LAN access for " Confirm Default policy Default Detected protocol: %1$s Detected protocols: %1$s Disagree Dismiss Enable always-on End: %1$s "Enjoy using LANShield!" Exceptionsanonymous Feedback Finish Get notified Give feedback In: %1$s Individual LAN traffic Todo individual_lan_traffic_explanation Info "First, you need to choose whether you want to block or allow LAN access by default. You can override this later for individual apps." "Got any feedback? You can share your remarks in the Settings tab!" "LANShield will notify you when an app tries to access the LAN for the first time, letting you allow or block it. In the next step you'll be asked to enable push notifications to receive these alerts. Don't worry, we won't spam you." "Welcome! LANShield allows you to control which apps have access to your local network." LAN Traffic LAN traffic blocking Here you can configure how LANShield should block or allow LAN traffic. In the 'Per app exceptions' page, you can set rules for every individual app on your device. If no rule is set, the 'Default policy' is applied. We advice against blocking system apps, since this might break some functionality. LAN traffic from %1$s Here you can see an overview of all apps that have sent or received LAN traffic. In some cases, LANShield is not able to detect which app caused certain packets to be sent; these are categorized under 'Unknown'. LANShield enabled LANShield lets you control
LAN access of other apps LANShield logo Last 24h: %1$s Last seen: %1$s Learn more on lanshield.eu Logo Manage notifications Manually allowed %1$s app%2$s Manually blocked %1$s app%2$s More info Next No LAN traffic detected Notifications Out: %1$s Overview To enable LANShield automatically after a reboot, go to the LANShield VPN settings on the next screen and check the 'Always-on VPN' option. For protecting your LAN traffic, LANShield uses a virtual local VPN connection in order to control LAN access of other apps on your device. Although you'll see a VPN notification, no VPN connection to the outside internet will be made. For protecting your LAN traffic, LANShield needs to set up a virtual local VPN interface. In the next step you'll be asked to grant this permission to LANShield. No VPN connection to the outside internet will be made. Peer: %1$s - %2$s Per app exceptions
"Here you can configure whether you want to block or allow LAN traffic on a per app basis." Policy: allow LAN traffic Policy: block LAN traffic Previous Privacy policy Search Share Set a default policy Settings Sharing
 Show system apps Start: %1$s System apps MainActivity Total: %1$s Unknown VPN notification VPN permission request You're all set! Export LAN Traffic Advanced General
